Event: 1492: Granada, the last Moorish stronghold in España, surrenders
1610: First sighting of Ganymede & Callisto by Galileo
1909: Shackleton reaches the southernmost part of Antarctica so far
49 BCE: Julius Caesar crosses the Rubicon
1910: First public radio broadcast (Met Opera, NYC)
1920: First council meeting of the League of Nations
250: Pope Fabian executed by Roma as disloyal
1556: Shaanxi earthquake, most lethal in history (830k dead)
Tatiana Day, celebration of students and Moscow State University
1891: Coronation of Queen Lili'uokalani of Hawaii
1884: First volume of Oxford English Dictionary published
Presentation of Jesus at the Temple (Candlemas)
1870: USA 15th Amendment ratified granting voting rights to all races
1964: The Beatles perform on US television for the first time
1840: Marriage of Queen Victoria of England to Prince Albert
1867: First transit of the Suez Canal
Wealth of Nations by Adam Smith published
797: Coronation of Byzantine Empress Irene Sarantapechaina of Athens
Marcus Aurelius, David Hume, Ludwig Wittgenstein
Venezuela, Algeria, Cape Verde, & Isle of Man
1864: Last battle of the Taiping Rebellion
1969: Apollo 11: Armstrong and Aldrin step onto Luna
India, North Korea, South Korea, Republic of the Congo
1942: Start of the Battle of Stalingrad
Costa Rica, El Salvator, Guatamala, Honduras & Nicaragua
Fête de l'opinion (Convictions & criticism of government)
Death of Laika (first animal to orbit the Earth)
1960: Dr Jane Goodall: First observation of nonhumans (chimpanzees) using tools
1989: Demolition of the Berlin Wall begins
2014: Spacecraft Philae is first to land on a comet
1947: Marriage of Queen (then Princess) Elizabeth II of England
Feast of the Bodhi & the Immaculate Conception
220: End of the Han Dynasty of China
Feast of Saint Nicholas of Myra
